description:
The trailhead is located appox 17 minutes east of Revelstoke on the Trans Canada Highway. The trail consists of a hard packed surface and wooden boardwalks making it fully accesable to all users.
As you walk along the 1.2km loop you will be provided with stunning veiws of the Selkirk Mountains and the wide variety of birds that make this area their home.
The tailhead area has a covered picnic area, toilets, easy access to the highway and a stunning veiw it is a great place to stop with the family on your way thought to many of the other mountian parks.
title: Skunk Cabbage Interpretive Trail
